text: it's my first time here in Davos but
over the years this event has been
criticized for its gender balance the
overwhelming majority of the delegates
here are men so it would really be more
accurate to call it a grave gender
imbalance it is something though that
the organizers have been trying to
change there's a lot of work that we've
been doing and trying to benchmark
gender gaps and trying to put together
into the best practices on how to close
the gender gaps we've been trying to
bring together communities of people
we're working with various governments
to try to close those economic gender
gaps but one of the issues is of course
to ensure that women should be at the
table you might be wondering why this is
important is gender diversity just about
looking good in the 21st century in fact
there is some intriguing evidence about
the impact that women leaders have on
the performance of their companies we
looked at those companies that had a
board that purely consisted of men and
another board that had both men and
women and we found across the number of
financial metrics that the ones that had
both men and women performed
significantly better in what way
financially financially yes I return on
sales return on equity as the two main
criteria do you think that was because
of the women well I don't think it's
just because they had women on boards
but i think it's about what that
indicates about the organization one
prominent business leader who's become a
divorce regular is nine allall kidwai
who runs hsbc in india and also sits on
hsbc asia-pacific's board she's become
known as a trailblazer for Indian women
if you look at the world of banking now
India has been quite remarkable in that
we probably have the highest
representation of women
use in banking anywhere in the world
thirty percent of our major banks are
now women CEOs and the last six months
we saw six come in into the government
owned banks the public sector banks so
what that tells me is that we've had
women come through the workplace these
issues of diversity and equality won't
be solved in a day and what the
organizers here have learned is that
setting quotas for some participants
isn't in itself enough but given the
forum's reputation as an incubator of
ideas it is really important that the
women issue stays on the agenda
